events.title: Bermuda snail thought to be extinct now thrives after a decadeâ€™s effort

events.description: Three incidents of damage to rail infrastructure around Bologna in northern Italy are being investigated. Authorities said journeys to day one of the Winter Olympic Games have been disrupted.

events.title: Polls wrap up in Thailand's election, incumbent PM seeks new term
events.description: Vote counting was underway in Thailand's early general election on Sunday, seen as a three-way race among competing visions of progressive, populist and old-fashioned patronage politics. Coalition negotiations are expected to follow soon after, with no party forecast to secure an overall majority. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondant in Bangkok, Tommy Walker.

events.title: Washington Post CEO resigns after sweeping job cuts
events.description: The Washington Post said Saturday its CEO and publisher Will Lewis was leaving effective immediately, just days after the storied newspaper owned by billionaire Amazon founder Jeff Bezos made drastic job cuts that angered readers. Story by Simon Moritz.
events.ticker_label: ğŸ’¥ Washington Post CEO resigns after sweeping job cuts

events.title: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi hopes for big win in snap elections
events.description: Polls opened Sunday in parliamentary elections that Japan's popular Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi hopes will give her struggling party a big enough win to push through an ambitious conservative political agenda. Story by Nicholas Rushworth.

events.title: Von Allmen, a glorious downhill
events.description: Swiss skier Franjo Von Allmen was crowned Olympic downhill champion this Saturday in Bormio. He finished ahead of Italians Giovanni Franzoni and Dominik Paris.

events.title: Japanese PM's election gamble set to pay off
events.description: Japan's ultra conservative prime minister is set to seize more power after an exit poll suggested she has secured a big majority in the lower house following a snap election.

events.title: Winter Olympics crowd ignored plea not to boo - and opening ceremony became outlet for rage
events.description: For a largely sedate and elegant spectacle, the Winter Olympics opening ceremony still became an outlet for rage in Milan.

events.title: France's former culture minister resigns over Epstein-linked tax fraud probe

events.title: Thailand votes in early election with 3 main parties vying for power
events.description: Voters in Thailand are heading to the polls for an early general election

events.title: Tourists stopped from seeing The Last Supper, while Olympic VIPs including Vance visit
events.description: Tourists in Milan during the Winter Olympics faced disappointment as access to Leonardo da Vinciâ€™s The Last Supper was closed for three and a half days

events.title: Yemen's ruling council names new cabinet after deadly clashes in the south
events.description: Yemen's ruling leadership council has named a new cabinet following deadly clashes in the south and the dissolution of a separatist group

events.title: Epstein revelations have toppled top figures in Europe while US fallout is more muted
events.description: The Jeffrey Epstein files have rocked Europe's elite, revealing ties to a prince, an ambassador, and top politicians

events.title: Fatwas, faith and fallacies: Myth-busting female genital mutilation in Africa
events.description: Olivia Albert, 19, was subjected to female genital (FGM) mutilation when she was 14. She told the UN sexual and reproductive health agency (UNFPA) that she hid her pain because everyone around her said it was normal.

events.description: UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker TÃ¼rk launched a $400 million appeal on Thursday in Geneva, as his office (OHCHR) continues to operate â€œin survival modeâ€.

events.title: Bishop Ronald Hicks replaces Dolan as Archbishop of New York with installation at St Patrick's
events.description: New York Archbishop Ronald Hicks officially installed at St. Patrick's Cathedral, taking over the helm after Cardinal Timothy Dolan's retirement.

events.title: 'White saviors'' use of whistles causes bitter internal rift inside anti-ICE movement
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Fox News True Crime Newsletter: Nancy Guthrie's abduction, Ohio dentist's autopsy, Suitcase Killer's sentence
events.description: Stay up to date with the Fox News True Crime Newsletter, which brings you the latest cases ripped from the headlines, from crime to courts, legal and scandal.

events.title: More than a dozen anti-ICE agitators hauled away by NYPD near Columbia University
events.description: Thirteen anti-ICE agitators were arrested near Columbia University after blocking the main entrance, defying NYPD orders for 20 minutes.

events.title: 12 Minneapolis anti-ICE agitators arrested after massive crowd gathers outside Hilton hotel
events.description: At least 12 arrested at Minneapolis Hilton hotel during anti-ICE demonstration that drew up to 175 people making noise with pots, pans and whistles.

events.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.

events.title: Trump's special envoy Witkoff and Kushner visit US aircraft carrier amid Iran tensions, talks
events.description: Trump envoy Witkoff and Jared Kushner visited the USS Abraham Lincoln amid Iran tensions as Netanyahu prepares a Washington meeting to discuss limiting Tehran's ballistic missiles.

events.title: Iran's Khamenei stays away from talks as JD Vance says dynamic makes diplomacy 'much more complicated'
events.description: Vice President JD Vance calls Iran diplomacy "bizarre" as Supreme Leader Khamenei stays away from negotiations starting starting on Friday in Oman, complicating U.S.-Iran talks.

events.title: US special envoy Witkoff announces US, Ukrainian and Russian delegations agree to prisoner swap
events.description: The U.S., Ukrainian, and Russian delegations have agreed to an exchange of 314 prisoners, according to U.S. special envoy Steve Witkoff's office.

events.title: UK to release files related to former ambassador's Jeffrey Epstein ties
events.description: U.K. government commits to releasing files on Peter Mandelson's appointment as ambassador to the U.S. despite his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.
